group_1.textRight: So you became a Magical Girl, then...
So that's what happened.
Still, you're amazing, Rabitan.
Yeah, because of your wish,
your gramps' field was brought back to life@and your family protects what's important to them.
Plus, Rabitan,@all those organic veggies your gramps growsー
doesn't that mean he's saving lots of kids?

group_1.textLeft: Saving, though... I honestly don't know if I can say@he's saving them,
but I do think children in similar situations@as me and their families are gaining hope...

group_1.textRight: And that's amazing, isn't it!
I'd certainly say so.
It is thanks to Rabi that many have been saved.
...Hey, this story... You think Mii could use this@for the web newspaper?
Cause like,@your condition is hard to understand, right?
And Mii had no idea about this@until hearing from you...
Even just in my class,
there's kids with troubles just like the old Rabitan,
so I think ー even if it's just a little bit ー@letting them know would be a great idea!

group_1.textLeft: That isn't a problem for me, but...
What would you do about the Magical Girl wish@part...?

group_1.textRight: Oh...
Guess you can't write that in a newspaper, huh...?
Ugh...@And here I thought it was a good idea, too...

group_1.textLeft: Besides, I don't think I can tell them
that eating Grandfather's vegetables@will make them as healthy as me...

group_1.textRight: Huh? They won't?

group_1.textLeft: Magical Girls gain improved physical abilities@in order to fight Witches.
You both know this, don't you?

group_1.textRight: Indeed, I read about it in Papa's book@as well as experiencing it firsthand.
Yep, Mii too.
Oh, so Rabitan got better because...

group_1.textLeft: Yes, by becoming a Magical Girl,@my physical abilities improved...
And, as a side effect, my constitution became better.

group_1.textRight: I see...
